sections.info: Georgia Institute of Technology | CS6476 | Spring 2020

subsections.name: Activity Recognition
subsections.description: This was my final project following a 2001 paper from Bobick and James. The technique here used motion history images (MHIs) and motion energy (MEIs) to capture the activity at each frame. From there the problem of where there activity was happening in the image (translation), at what angle (rotation), and size (scale) had to be accounted for. Hu Moments gave these invariants in seven phases that could be then fed to a discriminative classifier. I chose a random forest.

subsections.description: Here Mitt Romney’s hand is being tracked not only as it randomly moves, but also as it randomly changes.

subsections.name: Augmented Reality
subsections.description: Augmented reality was one of my favorite problem sets. The goal here was to find markers at each frame, warp the image to augment the scene, and then of course overlay it while being robust to noise, rotation, and minor occlusions.

subsections.name: OpenAI Gym's Lunar Lander V2
subsections.description: The Lunar Lander V2 is a continuous environment from OpenAI where the task to be completed is a self landing rocket. At each time step, the agent knows this state vector: x, y, vx, vy, θ, vθ, left-leg, right-leg; position, velocity, respective angles, and if its legs are touching the ground. I used an actor-critic technique with prioritized experience replay to get the result seen above.

subsections.name: Automated Lawnmower Simulation
subsections.description: For this final project, an automated lawn mower simulation had to be built that not only avoided obstacles, recharged its battery, but had to also avoid chasing gophers. This was a bit challenging since the gophers had global knowledge of the mowers, but I think we did alright. I primarily worked on the front end.
